results.title: Station 10
results.creator_credit: Michael Scott, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a factual account of the life of policemen at one station in Montreal, drawn from sixty days and nights of on-the-spot filming. It is a view of life in the inner city that usually only the policeman has reason to encounter. There are ugly incidents here, but there is also reassurance that people in trouble do have help at hand, and that even for the law breaker the policeman does his work with impartiality, and usually with understanding and good humour. (Awards: Montreal; Melbourne.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Scott, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Starting Crochet
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
Crochet is a soothing, rhythmic craft, practised throughout the world for thousands of years - using only a hook and a length of thread. This video and its accompanying booklet will show you how to begin, the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches; as well as some attractive items which are easy to make. Introduced by Hannah Gordon.

results.title: Starting Tapestry
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There is a wonderfully rich variety of tapestry styles throughout the world, and the techniques are easy to learn. This video and its accompanying booklet will show you how to begin, the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Introduced by Hannah Gordon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions

results.title: Starting Embroidery (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There are many beautiful and fascinating styles of embroidery practised around the world. “Starting embroidery” will show you the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Hannah Gordon introduces the many possibilities embroidery offers to everyone, young and old.

results.title: Starting Tapestry (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There is a wonderfully rich variety of tapestry styles throughout the world and the techniques are easy to learn at any age. “Starting tapestry” will show you the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Hannah Gordon introduces the many possibilities tapestry offers to everyone, young and old.

results.title: Starting from scratch
results.creator_credit: Alastair Matheson, Horst Cerni, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and UNICEF
results.brief_description: The determined people of Tanzania in East Africa are “starting from scratch” to build up their country’s health, education and welfare services. We meet two women, typical of the many helping to build Tanzania’s future: Aurelia, a teacher trained with UNICEF assistance, and Mageta, a dietician travelling from village to village.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alastair Matheson, Horst Cerni, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and UNICEF
results.description: The determined people of Tanzania in East Africa are “starting from scratch” to build up their country’s health, education and welfare services. We meet two women, typical of the many helping to build Tanzania’s future: Aurelia, a teacher trained with UNICEF assistance, and Mageta, a dietician travelling from village to village.

We meet two women, typical of the many helping to build Tanzania’s future: Aurelia, a teacher trained with UNICEF assistance, and Mageta, a dietician travelling from village to village.
